newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania M2 money supply rises 7.5 pct in October.
newsitem.headline: Romania M2 money supply rises 7.5 pct in October.

text.p: Romania's M2 money supply rose 7.5 percent in October from September, well above monthly inflation of 3.4 percent, and rose 68.4 percent year on year, National Bank (BNR) data showed on Thursday.
ROMANIAN MONEY SUPPLY OCT 96 SEPT 96 OCT 95

M1 narrow money, which includes currency outside banks and demand deposits, expanded to 9.5 trillion lei at end-October from 8.5 trillion in September, with cash in circulation rising to 4.5 trillion lei from 4.3 trillion.
Household savings rose slightly to 7.6 trillion lei from 7.4 trillion on inflationary fears and traditional pre-winter dollar hoarding.
Residents' hard currency deposits edged up to $1.7 billion in October from $1.66 billion in September, accounting for 22.2 percent of broad money. -- Luli Popescu, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
